title: 2 years ago, my age was 4 and a half times my son's age. 6 years ago, my age was twice the square of my son's age. What is the present ages of me and my son? - Quora

response.answer_text: Age questions can be solved easily by looking at options. Learn proper algebraic method but apply it only if necessary. If options available for sons age like below A. 8 B.10 C.12 D.20 Just take 12 as sons age. Before 2 years 10 hence fathers age 45. But 6 years before he would be 6 and twice the square would 72 which is wrong with dads age 45–4=41. If you take 8 then 2 years before son was 6 and dad was 27. But 6 years before son was 2 and twice the square gives 8 but father was 27–4=23 If you take 10 then 2 years earlier son = 8 and dad = 36 as per question. 6 years earlier son= 4 and dad = 32. From other equation also age is 32 only 36–4=32. Hence this is the right answer. This is the easiest way if you good at mind calculation. You dont have to touch the pen for this.

Let 2 years ago, son's age be x. So my age(2 years ago) =4.5 x So, 6 years ago, My age=4.5x-4 Son's age=x-4 B/C, 4.5x-4=2((x-4)^2) or, 4x^2–41x+72=0 Solving the quadratic, we get- x=8 or x=2.5(not possible) So my present age of=4.5x+2=38 My son's present age=x+2=10.(Ans)
